items.title: Test verification and API marketplace preparation
items.description: Run comprehensive tests to verify production readiness, fix stale VideoTranscript naming references, create API marketplace tracking list, and prepare RapidAPI integration (OpenAPI spec, pricing tiers, documentation).

items.title: Rename VideoTranscript to OmniTranscripts
items.description: Rename project from VideoTranscript to OmniTranscripts and formally expand scope from library-only to combined library + HTTP API. Includes: updating Go module name to 'omnitranscripts', creating engine/ package for public library consumption, adding minimal TranscriptionError with stage-specific errors, documenting GitHub repo rename steps, updating all documentation and references.

items.title: Fix Command Injection Risk in web-dashboard.go
items.description: User-controlled input (job.VideoID, url) is passed directly to exec.Command() without proper sanitization. The pgrep -f command and yt-dlp command in web-dashboard.go:3297 and web-dashboard.go:3507 could be vulnerable to command injection if VideoID or URL contains shell metacharacters. Remediation: Validate and sanitize VideoID to ensure it only contains expected characters (alphanumeric, hyphens). URL validation should be strengthened.

items.title: Implement Duration Parsing
items.description: The parseDuration() function in engine/engine.go:189-191 and lib/transcription.go:268-270 returns a hardcoded value of 120 seconds instead of actually parsing the duration. This affects the sync/async processing decision logic. Remediation: Implement actual duration parsing from yt-dlp output format (e.g., 'HH:MM:SS' or 'MM:SS').

items.title: Add Unit Tests for Core Packages
items.description: Several core packages have no test files: config/ (no unit tests for configuration loading), engine/ (no unit tests for transcription engine), jobs/ (no unit tests for job queue operations). Remediation: Add unit tests for these packages, especially for configuration validation and job state transitions.

items.title: Replace Debug Logging with Structured Logging
items.description: Production code contains numerous fmt.Printf and fmt.Println statements instead of using structured logging: lib/transcription.go (15+ instances), engine/engine.go (10+ instances), web-dashboard.go (5+ instances including console.log in embedded JS). Remediation: Replace with structured logging (e.g., log.Printf with proper log levels, or a logging library like zap/zerolog).
